docs.title: Membership
docs.text: Most videos and courses are free and available publicly, yet some are only available for members. Free videos and courses can be found on YouTube or any other platforms.

docs.title: Access
docs.text:
Members can have access to their videos and courses using

  • course.shakiba.net

Note

the subdomain courses is for this document and the subdomain course is for members (accessing contents privately)

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
Features of private platform

  • no add
  • direct download link
  • resume of each video
  • watching on web browser or your Android/iOS phone

docs.title: VPS
docs.text:
VPN and Proxy Servers Courses

Over these years I have been working with many VPN servers and Proxies. Here are some one them

  • VPNs
    • OpenConnect (ocserv)
      • Cisco anyconnect protocol
    • SoftEther 4/5
      • openvpn
      • SSTP
      • L2TP
    • Nebula (mesh network)
    • Tinc (mesh network)
    • WireGuard
    • SSH
      • tun mode
      • tap mode
  • Proxies (forwards)
    • SSH
    • Xray
    • Hysteria2
    • SingBox
  • Proxies (reverse)
    • HaProxy
    • Nginx

Also I have written CLIs to manage them using Bash or Nodejs

docs.title: sing-box proxy advanced
docs.text:
Course content of sing-box proxy advanced

Warning

The module content or title of videos may change. And probably you see slightly different title on YouTube

Note

Each module will be added to a separate video-playlist

docs.title: Module 1 review
docs.text:
• introduction and prerequisite
  • alternative modern proxies overview (clash, xray, hy2)
  • forward proxies versus reverse proxies
  • architecture of forward and reverse
  • singbox as reverse proxy

docs.title: Module 2 tun
docs.text:
• split tunneling
  • full tunneling
  • non-root users
  • L3 versus L4 tun interfaces

docs.title: Module 3 DNS
docs.text:
• dns resolution
  • dns resolution with tun
  • dns hijacking
  • dns over proxy
  • dns over tls DoT
  • private dns server
  • dns rule action
  • dns fakeip

docs.title: Available to watch on
docs.text: • YouTube singbox proxy advanced module 1 review

docs.title: introduction and prerequisite
docs.text:
To get started with the course

  • make sure you have seen the sing-box proxy overview course
  • our test environment is Linux and a Terminal
  • a VPS (Virtual Private Server) with a public IP
  • your favorite text editor

Note

if you are already familiar with any of modern proxies, you can take the course directly

Tip

prior experience with Terminal Multiplexers are valuable since we will open many Tabs and Sessions

docs.title: alternative modern proxies overview (clash, xray, hy2)
docs.text:
There are more modern proxies like

  • clash
  • xray
  • hysteria

and sing-box is one of them, if be familiar with any, you can learn others easily

docs.title: forward proxies versus reverse proxies
docs.text:
We will see the differences between the two, the forward proxies

  • sing-box
  • clash
  • xray
  • hysteria

and the reverse proxies

  • haproxy
  • nginx
  • traefikk
  • envoy

docs.title: architecture of forward and reverse
docs.text: We will see the core design of forward proxies and reverse proxies

docs.title: singbox as reverse proxy
docs.text: We will do a test of using sing-box as a reverse proxy. We see that we can make it work, but also we know forward proxies have not been intended to be used as a reverse proxy.

docs.title: Available to watch on
docs.text: • YouTube singbox proxy advanced module 2 tun

docs.title: split tunneling
docs.text: We see what is a split tunnel and its use cases

docs.title: full tunneling
docs.text: We see what is a full tunnel and its use cases

docs.title: non-root users
docs.text: For non-root users we can use the proxy part of sing-box, but for tun use cases we should have root privilege

docs.title: L3 versus L4 tun interfaces
docs.text: Well known VPNs like OpenVPN, WireGuard operate at layer 3 (tun mode) but sing-box tun interface is not a layer 3 but a layer 4 one
